title: Cat-scratch disease
summary: Cat-scratch disease (CSD) or felinosis is an infectious disease that most often results from a scratch or bite of a cat.[4] Symptoms typically include a non-painful bump or blister at the site of injury and painful and swollen lymph nodes.[2] People may feel tired, have a headache, or a fever.[2] Symptoms typically begin within 3â€“14 days following infection.[2]
